trans-unit.source: Represents a single data point collected from the digitizer and stylus.
A <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> collects data when a user inputs ink using the digitizer.
Because the information that a digitizer reports differs depending on the manufacturer, the properties within a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> can vary.
To determine whether a property is in the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint>, call the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.HasProperty%2A> method.

The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.Description%2A> property contains a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that specifies which properties are in the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint>.
All <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects contain properties that specify the (x, y) coordinates, as well as the pressure.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> class using specified (x, y) coordinates.
The x-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The y-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> class using specified (x, y) coordinates and pressure.
`pressureFactor` must have a value between 0 and 1, inclusive.
A value of 0 indicates that no pressure is applied, while a value of 1 indicates that the maximum amount of pressure is applied.
A value of 0.5 indicates that 50% of the maximum pressure is applied, and so on.
The x-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The y-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The amount of pressure applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
pressureFactor is less than 0 or greater than 1.
Initializes a new instance of the class using specified (x, y) coordinates, a pressureFactor, and additional parameters specified in the .
The x-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The y-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The amount of pressure applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that specifies the additional properties stored in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
An array of 32-bit signed integers that contains the values of the properties defined in stylusPointDescription.
pressureFactor is less than 0 or greater than 1.
-or-
The values in additionalValues that correspond to button properties are not 0 or 1.
The number of values in additionalValues does not match the number of properties in stylusPointDescription minus 3.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that specifies the properties stored in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> specifies the properties stored in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
Returns a value indicating whether the specified object is equal to the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
`true` if the objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects are equal.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance.
Returns the value of the specified property.

To check whether the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> contains the specified property, call the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.HasProperty%2A> before calling either the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.GetPropertyValue%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.SetPropertyValue%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty"></xref> that specifies which property value to get.
The value of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty"></xref>.
stylusPointProperty is not one of the properties in .
Returns whether the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> contains the specified property.

To check whether the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> contains the specified property, call the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.HasProperty%2A> before calling either the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.GetPropertyValue%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.SetPropertyValue%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty"></xref> to check for in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty"></xref> is in the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Specifies the largest valid value for a pair of (x, y) coordinates.
Specifies the smallest valid value for a pair of (x, y) coordinates.
Compares two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects and determines whether they are equal.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.Equals%28System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint%2CSystem.Windows.Input.StylusPoint%29?displayProperty=fullName>
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Casts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
The following example demonstrates how to cast a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> to a <xref:System.Windows.Point> object to draw a circle at the beginning of every stroke.

This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> object called `inkcanvas1` and that the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.StylusDown> event is connected to the event handler in the example.
A that contains the same (x,y) coordinates as stylusPoint.
Returns a Boolean value which indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects are unequal.
The equivalent method for this operator is the negation of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.Equals%2A>
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects are unequal; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value between 0 and 1 that reflects the amount of pressure the stylus applies to the digitizer's surface when the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> is created.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.PressureFactor%2A> property is expressed as a value between 0 and 1.
A value of 0 indicates that no pressure is applied, while a value of 1 indicates that the maximum amount of pressure is applied.
A value of 0.5 indicates that 50% of the maximum pressure is applied, and so on.
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the amount of pressure the stylus applies to the digitizer's surface as the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> is created.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.PressureFactor"></xref> property is set to a value less than 0 or greater than 1.
Sets the specified property to the specified value.

To check whether the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> contains the specified property, call the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.HasProperty%2A> before calling either the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.GetPropertyValue%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint.SetPropertyValue%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty"></xref> that specifies which property value to set.
The value of the property.
stylusPointProperty is not one of the properties in .
Converts a <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the value for the x-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The x-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The y-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
